title: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a.
Mnemonics.
No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for superclass), so it could be done.
At least isValidTypeName.
Label could say 'Select destination type:'.

Bug Description: The browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Destination type can be the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
OB:
The browse button is too small.
Title is used for long text.
When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Destination type can be the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
EB:
The browse button should be of standard size (using SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
The title should not be used for long text on the next page.
When going to the next page, it should not display 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Destination type should not be the same as the source type to avoid false refactoring warnings and pseudo changes in referencing classes.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the dialog.
2. Observe that the browse button is too small.
3. Observe that the title is used for long text on the next page.
4. Proceed to the next page and observe that it displays 'Type not found'.
5. Check that the dialog shows types from folders of other projects.
6. Validate if the destination type can be the same as the source type and if there are any refactoring warnings or pseudo changes in referencing classes.
